chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard G. Mundy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Mundy on Probation for two years consecutive to any other sentence in being

[MK] case called at 9:34am 
Defendant Richard G. Mundy appears by Zoom videoconferencing from Racine Correctional Institution, in custody. Attorney Francis Raff in court.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds the video-connection to be sight and sound sufficient.
The Court verifies with Mr. Mundy that he understands that he has the right to be present in the courtroom for sentencing, and he is waiving this right.  

The Court indicates that the Court's direct appointment of Attorney Raff as counsel was not intended. The Court indicates that what was supposed to happen and is going to happen is: nunc pro tunc to July 5, 2022 the contract that is in place is the basis for Attorney Raff's appointment as counsel in this case. 

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3.

On Count #1 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Mundy on Probation for two years consecutive to any other sentence in being, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education programming
--to comply with DNA sample provision on demand
--to pay costs and the DNA surcharge

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony firearm and voting prohibition warnings are given
recess 10:00am
Letter to Court re 09.01.2022 Hearing

[ma] Case called at 11:05 AM 
Defendant Richard G. Mundy appears via videoconferencing from Racine Correctional Institution, in custody.   Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.

The Court reviews the court record; including submission from SPD that efforts continue to appoint counsel. 

Mr. Mundy inquiries if he can be his own attorney and speedy trial case.

The Court appoints Attorney Frank Raff. 

The Court sets for Preliminary Hearing on a speedy basis. 

The Court directs writ to be prepared for Mr. Mundy's appearance.

[ma] Case called at 1:16pm [All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Richard G. Mundy appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 


The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct; but that mail should be sent to Jefferson County Jail as he is currently on a supervision/probation hold. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

recess 1:20  pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 4/22/22 at 8:30am
